TITLE: Mark Cuban: ‘People thought I was an idiot’ for launching the company I sold for billions
SUMMARY: Mark Cuban says skeptics laughed in 1995 when he launched Broadcast.com, the streaming audio startup that eventually sold to Yahoo for $5.7 billion.

TITLE: Are you buying 'too much car'? Americans' obsession with pricey options like touch screens is causing an affordability crisis
SUMMARY: With the lucrative luxury segment in such high demand, carmakers are upgrading their lineups and scaling back on less expensive cars.

TITLE: The condo king of Miami bets his new Fisher Island luxury project can weather a recession
SUMMARY: Jorge Perez and his Related Group are behind the 10-story, 50-unit Fisher Island project that boasts a sell-out price of $1.2 billion.

TITLE: Mega Millions jackpot is $1.35 billion. Here are 3 tips for navigating a win's 'cycles of surprise,' says advisor
SUMMARY: If you find yourself holding the winning ticket, these three tips can help you get off on the right foot as you start navigating your new-found wealth.

TITLE: Despite falling inflation, nearly one-third of Americans will rely on tax refunds, survey finds. Here's how to get your refund faster
SUMMARY: Despite falling inflation, many Americans will rely on their tax refund to make ends meet, a survey finds. Here's how to get your tax refund faster.

TITLE: South Koreans are the world's biggest spenders on luxury goods
SUMMARY: Morgan Stanley says South Koreans spend more on luxury goods per capita than even American or Chinese nationals.

TITLE: Why Singapore isn't imposing new travel rules on visitors from China
SUMMARY: Singapore's government cites statistics to show why new rules for Chinese travelers won't necessarily make Singapore safer from Covid-19 right now.

TITLE: Tax season opens for individual filers on Jan. 23, says IRS
SUMMARY: The IRS will start accepting 2022 tax returns for individual filers on Jan. 23, the agency announced Thursday.

TITLE: Delta curbs employee access to luxury airport lounges as it struggles with crowding
SUMMARY: Delta said employees traveling on their company travel perks can't use its airport Sky Clubs.

TITLE: Porsche sees small uptick in global sales despite big drop in Taycan EV
SUMMARY: Porsche said a 16% drop in global sales of its electric Taycan were "due to supply chain bottlenecks and limited component availability."

TITLE: Iconic Kobe Bryant jersey up for auction, expected to fetch up to $7 million
SUMMARY: A jersey that Kobe Bryant wore for 25 games during his MVP season is being sold at auction by Sotheby's.

TITLE: After 'misery' for tax filers in 2022, IRS to start 2023 tax season stronger, taxpayer advocate says
SUMMARY: After another challenging year for the IRS in 2022, the agency may be primed for a better 2023 tax season, according to the Taxpayer Advocate Service.

TITLE: Mega Millions jackpot jumps to $1.35 billion for the next drawing. Here's the tax bill if there's a winner
SUMMARY: Your winnings would be reduced by a 24% federal tax withholding, but that would be just the start of what you'd owe to the IRS and, possibly, state coffers.

TITLE: ‘Don’t wait until March’ to hire a tax pro, says advisor — 3 moves to make before the 2023 tax filing season opens
SUMMARY: Tax season is almost here, and there are key things to know before the IRS begins accepting 2022 individual returns, experts say.

TITLE: South Korea shares eye-opening Covid statistics to defend its new rules for travelers from China
SUMMARY: South Korea hit back at claims its Covid rules for Chinese travelers are "discriminatory," saying more than half of its imported cases are coming from China.

TITLE: House Republicans vote to strip IRS funding, following pledge to repeal nearly $80 billion approved by Congress
SUMMARY: House Republicans on Monday night voted to slash funding for the IRS, following a pledge to repeal the nearly $80 billion approved by Congress last year.

TITLE: Mega Millions jackpot is $1.1 billion. How big winners can prep for 'the inevitable asking for money' from family, friends
SUMMARY: While winning can make you a target for people seeking to benefit from your newfound wealth, there are ways to minimize the requests for money.

TITLE: Mark Cuban says he doesn't need his billions: I'd ‘for sure’ be just as happy with 1% of my net worth
SUMMARY: An interviewer asked Mark Cuban if he'd be as happy with just 1% of his $4.6 billion net worth. 'If I had my same family and everything, for sure,' Cuban said.

TITLE: Chinese travelers say new restrictions are 'unfair' — but they're angry at some countries more than others
SUMMARY: Some Chinese travelers say they're not going to South Korea and Japan — not because they're boycotting them, but because they're being blocked from entering.

TITLE: Rolls-Royce sees record sales in 2022, no slowdown in spending by the wealthy
SUMMARY: Rolls-Royce sold a record number of cars in 2022 as demand for its $500,000 vehicles remained strong.

TITLE: How to balance retirement and emergency savings in a shaky economy
SUMMARY: Experts cover how to decide between saving to your 401(k) for retirement versus your emergency fund in an unsteady economy.

TITLE: Mega Millions jackpot is $940 million: Here's what to do if you come into a large sum of money
SUMMARY: Whether it's an inheritance, sale of a property, bonus or even a tax refund, there are many ways to end up with a windfall apart from winning the lottery.

TITLE: Richard Branson left school at 15—his headmaster said he'd either 'go to prison' or 'become a millionaire’
SUMMARY: Richard Branson left school at 15 after he raised enough money to start a magazine. His then-headmaster told him that persuasiveness could lead to his success or downfall.

TITLE: IRS: Taxpayers may avoid a surprise tax bill by making a quarterly payment by Jan. 17
SUMMARY: The fourth-quarter estimated tax deadline is Jan. 17. Here's how to avoid a 'surprise tax bill' for 2022, according to the IRS.

TITLE: Who is Bernard Arnault? The new world’s richest person admires Buffett and Jobs while running Louis Vuitton and Dior
SUMMARY: LVMH CEO Bernard Arnault passed Elon Musk to become the world's wealthiest person at the end of 2022. He used lessons from Warren Buffett and Steve Jobs to do it.

TITLE: Mortgage interest rates expected to drop in 2023—here's by how much
SUMMARY: Economic uncertainty will lead to slightly lower mortgage rates in 2023, but home prices will remain high.

TITLE: Where to keep your cash amid high inflation and rising interest rates: It's 'a little tricky,' says expert
SUMMARY: There are many options when saving for short-term goals, and it's trickier amid high inflation and rising interest rates. Here's what savers need to know.

TITLE: Here are some strategies that can help you dig out of holiday debt
SUMMARY: Americans spent more this holiday season and will likely take their time paying off any debt incurred. Here are seven steps that can help tackle debt.

TITLE: Manhattan apartment sales plunge in fourth quarter as brokers fear a frozen market
SUMMARY: Manhattan real estate brokers are concerned both buyers and sellers are staying on the sidelines.

TITLE: The Mega Millions jackpot is $785 million. Taking the lump sum is 'typically a big mistake,' lottery lawyer says
SUMMARY: Nearly all winners opt for the lump sum, but with $785 million at stake, there are significant advantages to spreading out this lottery windfall.
